com.pilot.jword.view
Class JWordParagraphView

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.text.View
      javax.swing.text.CompositeView
          javax.swing.text.BoxView
              javax.swing.text.FlowView
                  javax.swing.text.ParagraphView
                      com.pilot.jword.view.JWordParagraphView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Fragmentable, javax.swing.SwingConstants, javax.swing.text.TabExpander
public class JWordParagraphView
extends javax.swing.text.ParagraphView
implements Fragmentable

Extended ParagraphView. This class implements Fragmetable for dividing paragraph along the Y-AXIS.
Handles Justified alignment with a different method, and overrides tab expansion

loadChildren

protected void loadChildren(javax.swing.text.ViewFactory f)
Loads all of the children to initialize the view. This is called by the setParent method. This is reimplemented to not load any children directly (as they are created in the process of formatting). If the layoutPool variable is null, an instance of LogicalView is created to represent the logical view that is used in the process of formatting.

Overrides:
loadChildren in class javax.swing.text.FlowView
Parameters:
f - the view factory

getFragments

public void getFragments(int minimumSpan,
                         int initialSpan,
                         int defaultSpan,
                         FragmentCollection fragments)
Description copied from interface: Fragmentable
Divide this view along the Y_AXIS and add Fragments to the given collection

Specified by:
getFragments in interface Fragmentable
Parameters:
minimumSpan - expresses the minimum allocated region for the first fragment, because of parents requirements
initialSpan - initial space available
defaultSpan - default space for second and later fragments
fragments - list of fragments. a collection to be filled by this method
